definition[0]: someone who is hurt or killed in an accident or war
example[0]: Our aim is to reduce road casualties.
example[1]: civilian casualties  (=people who are not soldiers who are injured or killed)
example[2]: The rebels have inflicted heavy casualties.
definition[1]: someone or something that suffers as a result of a particular event or situation
example[3]: The Safer City Project is the latest casualty of financial cutbacks.
definition[2]: the part of a hospital that people are taken to when they are hurt in an accident or suddenly become ill
example[4]: Jean ended up in casualty last night.
definition[3]: a British television drama programme about the doctors, nurses, and medical students who work in the casualty department of a hospital
definition[4]: a person, project, or company that suffers very badly or goes out of business as a result of something
example[5]: The airline is the latest casualty of the recession.
example[6]: The marketing department was one of the first casualties of the budget freeze.
definition[5]: an accident that causes injury, damage, or loss
